intro: Delissea comata, commonly known as the hairy delissea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Delissea comata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
